title: Delhi top cop removed after attack on CM Rekha Gupta; replacement named
content: Satish Golcha has been appointed as the new Commissioner of Police of Delhi, succeeding SBK Singh. This decision follows an assault on Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta during a public hearing at her Civil Lines office. The attacker, Sakariya Rajeshbhai Khimjibhai, has been arrested and faces charges including attempted murder.

title: 'Marking my territory': TVK chief roars at TN rally; no tie-ups with BJP, DMK
content: Vijay, the actor-turned-politician and president of Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), announced his candidacy for the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections from Madurai East, directly challenging the ruling DMK. He asserted TVK's commitment to Tamil causes, including retrieving Katchatheevu island, and criticized the DMK government's actions against protesting sanitation workers.

title: 'India won't engage with Pak but ...': Sports ministry issues new policy
content: India's Sports Ministry has clarified its stance on sports relations with Pakistan, prohibiting bilateral events but allowing participation in international tournaments where both nations are present. Additionally, Pakistani teams will be barred from competing in India. The ministry is also focused on attracting major sporting events by easing visa processes for international sports officials and ensuring proper protocol during their visits.

title: 'Planned disruption': Centre blames oppn for washout - what Monsoon session achieved
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and Rajya Sabha deputy chairman Harisvansh criticized the opposition for disrupting the Monsoon session, leading to significantly reduced productivity in both houses. Birla lamented the loss of discussion time, while Harivansh highlighted the low percentage of work accomplished.

title: Elon Musk teen prodigy quits after 2 yrs: Tech CEO responds, ‚ÄòNever heard of him‚Äô
content: Elon Musk claims ignorance of Kairan Quazi's SpaceX departure, despite the 16-year-old prodigy's two-year tenure at the company. Quazi, who joined SpaceX at 14, is transitioning to Citadel Securities, citing a desire for faster-paced challenges in quantitative finance. He previously criticized LinkedIn for age-based restrictions, highlighting biases in opportunity gatekeeping.

title: Parliament passes online gaming bill: Key provisions, aims - what Centre said
content: The Rajya Sabha has approved The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, aiming to regulate the rapidly growing online gaming sector and mitigate risks associated with money-based gaming. The bill categorizes online games into e-sports, online social games, and online money games, promoting the first two while strictly regulating the latter due to public health concerns.

title: Kerala Youth Cong chief resigns: Actor, writer allege harassment; 'invited me to hotel'
content: Rahul Mamkoottathil, Youth Congress state President, resigned amidst allegations made by women. At a press conference in Adoor, he claimed the accusations were a diversion from LDF government issues. Rahul asserted his innocence, stating no formal complaint was filed against him.

title: GST revamp: GoM backs Centre‚Äôs two-slab plan; accepts scrapping 12% & 28% rates
content: A Group of Ministers (GoM) has accepted a proposal to streamline the GST rate structure, reducing it from four slabs to two. The existing 12% and 28% rates would be eliminated, leaving standard rates of 5% and 18%. This reform aims to simplify the indirect tax system, provide relief to various sectors, and create a more transparent and growth-oriented regime.

title: Zuckerberg hits brake: Meta stops hiring and blocks transfers
content: Meta has halted AI division hiring amidst a restructuring of its 'Superintelligence Lab,' following a massive recruitment drive that lured talent from competitors with exorbitant compensation packages. This freeze comes after disappointing AI model performance and significant leadership departures, raising investor concerns about Meta's spiraling AI costs and the return on investment.

title: 'It‚Äôs a war': Gretzky‚Äôs legacy came under fire amid Trump‚Äôs trade war with Canada
content: Brantford, Ontario, Wayne Gretzky's hometown, faces economic challenges due to U.S. tariffs on Canadian goods. Local businesses, like Roustan Hockey, grapple with new trade restrictions, potentially impacting production and employment. While the tariffs stir controversy around Gretzky's ties to Trump, Brantford residents show resilience by supporting local products amidst economic uncertainty.

title: ‚ÄòLives of 3 lakh dogs‚Äô: What Delhi CM attacker told police during interrogation
content: Rajesh Sakriya Khimjibhai, accused of attacking Delhi CM Rekha Gupta, claimed his actions were motivated by concerns for Delhi's dog population. Currently in police custody, Khimjibhai's claims are under investigation, with authorities examining his phone, social media, and travel history. The assault, which occurred during a public interaction, is being treated as a potential assassination attempt.

title: 'Talked about traffic': MNS' Raj Thackeray squashes tie-up rumours
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray met with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to address critical urban planning and traffic congestion issues, particularly after heavy rainfall in Mumbai. Thackeray emphasized the need for long-term solutions, stricter enforcement of traffic rules, and public participation. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar downplayed the meeting's political significance, highlighting communication as a state tradition.

title: Nvidia's $920M headquarters covered with monumental triangles
content: Nvidia's $920 million headquarters in Santa Clara, California, showcases the company's history and tech-driven culture. The campus, featuring Voyager and Endeavor buildings, uses triangular motifs reflecting Nvidia's 3D graphics roots. AI-assisted design optimized daylight, acoustics, and collaboration spaces. The design incorporates 511 triangular skylights and over 14,000 plants, blending nature and technology for a sustainable, innovative workplace.

title: The Undertaker rumored to join Bigg Boss 19; Mike Tyson also in talks
content: Wrestling legend The Undertaker, Mark Calaway, is reportedly in talks to appear on the 19th season of the Indian reality show, Big Boss. Rumors suggest he might join as a wild card entry for a week-long stay, hosted by Salman Khan. Boxing icon Mike Tyson is also being considered for a guest appearance.

title: Ssshhh! Chess and the challenges of playing in front of a live audience
content: A grandmaster chess tournament in New Delhi emphasises silence and concentration, contrasting sharply with the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas, where spectators reacted boisterously to moves. Players expressed frustration with the distractions caused by the live audience, questioning whether chess is truly ready for such an environment.

title: Explained: India‚Äôs MBBS and PG seat boom what it means for future doctors
content: India has significantly increased its MBBS and postgraduate medical seats, aiming to boost healthcare accessibility and quality. While capacity has expanded considerably, particularly in states like Uttar Pradesh and Tamil Nadu, challenges persist with seat vacancies and ensuring uniform educational standards. Initiatives by the NMC and government programs are underway to address these issues and improve medical education.

title: Terror on wings: Pigeon carrying warning to blow up Jammu rly station caught
content: A pigeon carrying a threatening message, allegedly dispatched from Pakistan, was captured near the International Border in Jammu. The note, written in Urdu and English, warned of an imminent IED attack on the Jammu railway station, prompting heightened security measures.

title: FIR against Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs driver after cop injured during Voter Adhikar Yatra
content: An FIR has been lodged against the driver of Rahul Gandhi's vehicle after it reportedly hit a police constable during the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar's Nawada district. The incident occurred when the constable tripped and fell in front of the convoy. While the BJP criticized Gandhi, he was later seen assisting the injured officer.

title: LAC row: India to keep tight vigil; Several PLA arms brigades still remain forward deployed
content: "The way China has built roads, bridges, tunnels and habitats along the entire LAC, from eastern Ladakh to Arunachal, over the last five years, PLA troops can easily afford to pull back 100-150km and then come back again in 2-3 hours," a senior Army officer told TOI. ‚ÄãOur forces cannot. This huge time differential in mobilisation between the rival forces will have to be factored in during any de-escalation talks,a senior Army officer said.

title: Ahmedabad student murder: ‚ÄòKon hain, kya karlega tu?‚Äô Accused‚Äôs shocking chat surfaces on social media
content: Viral WhatsApp chats allegedly reveal the accused admitting to stabbing Nayan Satani, a Class 10 student, during an altercation. The messages show the accused recounting the incident and identifying the victim. A friend advises him to delete the chats and flee, prompting a police investigation into the authenticity of these exchanges as crucial evidence in the ongoing case.

title: 'No signal from Moscow to end war': Zelenskyy seeks US response if Putin avoids talks
content: President Zelensky has firmly stated Ukraine will not recognize Russia's territorial claims, demanding security guarantees within days before any talks. He seeks a strong US reaction if Russia avoids bilateral meetings, while outlining ambitious defense production plans. Amidst ongoing Russian attacks, Zelensky urges increased international pressure and support, emphasizing Moscow's disinterest in peace.

title: Top 15 highest-paying jobs in the US that could make you rich
content: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reports that specialized medical professionals like ophthalmologists, physicians, and radiologists top the list of highest-paying jobs, earning $239,200+ annually. These roles demand extensive education, rigorous training, and critical decision-making. Airline pilots also secure high salaries, reflecting their responsibility for passenger safety and efficient flight operations, with a median annual pay of $226,600.

title: 100 on debut! Prithvi Shaw announces Maharashtra arrival: 'Glad to start this way'
content: Prithvi Shaw marked his Maharashtra debut with a resilient century against Chhattisgarh in the Buchi Babu Tournament 2025, held in Chennai. After a top-order collapse, Shaw's 111-run innings stabilised the team, showcasing a return to form after a challenging period. This performance reignites hopes for a career resurgence as he aims to carry this momentum into the Ranji Trophy season.

title: Big revelation! 'He was better than Sachin Tendulkar': Vinod Kambli's brother
content: Virendra Kambli, brother of Vinod Kambli, speaks about Vinod and Sachin Tendulkar. He says Vinod never felt superior to Sachin. Virendra emphasises their strong friendship. Sachin still supports Vinod. They shared camaraderie during Ranji Trophy matches. Virendra recalls fun times in the dressing room. Vinod's Test average was impressive. Sachin became a record-breaking legend. Their bond remains strong.

title: Attack on Delhi CM Rekha Gupta: Attacker aspired to open animal hospital, loved dogs
content: Rajkot police identified Rajesh Sakariya, an autorickshaw driver and ardent dog lover, as the man who assaulted the Delhi chief minister. Sakariya's mother stated he is mentally unstable and was upset about the Supreme Court's ruling on stray dogs in Delhi, believing the chief minister would enforce it.

title: ‚ÄòBengali speakers must be Bangladeshis‚Äô: CU students attacked with hockey sticks, knives
content: Calcutta University students residing at Carmichael Hostel were assaulted by Hindi-speaking hawkers near Sealdah Bridge after being taunted for speaking Bengali and labeled as Bangladeshis. The altercation escalated from a price negotiation dispute to a violent attack with rods, hockey sticks, and knives, resulting in serious injuries to four students.

title: How Russia reshaped India‚Äôs oil map? Middle East steady; small players hit
content: Russia's dominance in India's oil imports has reshaped trading dynamics, impacting smaller suppliers while Iraq, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE maintain significant positions. Despite pressure to reduce Russian imports, India continues the supply, with Russia now being the top supplier. This shift has marginalized suppliers from America and Africa, creating potential for their resurgence amid ongoing geopolitical pressures.

title: Asia Cup: 'Mera naseeb hai' - Shreyas Iyer's father reveals son's emotional response
content: Santosh Iyer expressed his disappointment and perceived unfairness regarding his son Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup squad. Despite Shreyas' consistent IPL performances, including leading KKR to a title and PBKS to a final, selectors have overlooked him. Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar also criticized the decision, suggesting it indicates Iyer is no longer considered for T20 cricket.

title: NIRF 2025 rankings: What‚Äôs new, what‚Äôs changing, and what students should know
content: The NIRF 2025 rankings bring key changes, including a new Sustainable Development Goals category and negative scoring for retracted research papers. With parameters spanning teaching, research, inclusivity, and perception, the framework now emphasizes ethics, sustainability, and academic quality. Students should view rankings as one tool among many, considering faculty, infrastructure, and support before choosing institutions.

title: Dhanashree Verma breaks silence: Says parents urged divorce from Chahal
content: Dhanashree Verma and cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal‚Äôs divorce after five years of marriage turned into a painful chapter for both. The controversy only deepened when Chahal appeared in court wearing a T-shirt that read ‚ÄúBe Your Own Sugar Daddy.‚Äù Now, in a heartfelt conversation, Dhanashree has revealed how the separation deeply affected not just her but also her family.

title: Trish Stratus: WWE legend shares heartbreaking message announcing mother's passing
content: Trish Stratus, the WWE star, is grieving her mother, Alice Stratigeas. Alice passed away last week after battling cancer. Stratus shared a heartfelt tribute on Instagram. She expressed her deep sorrow and love for her mother. Stratus mentioned her mother's constant support. Alice was present throughout her career and family life.

title: What is Israel's E1 project? Long-frozen plan that will 'erase Palestine from the table'. What's next
content: Israel has greenlit the E1 settlement project in the West Bank, a move criticized for potentially bisecting Palestinian territories and obstructing a future state. Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich hailed the decision, while critics warn it will create an 'apartheid-like' system. The project, involving over 3,400 housing units, has faced international opposition for decades.

title: Over 70 still missing: As flood water recedes in J&K's Chasoti, severed limbs spook locals; toll rises to 68
content: Flash floods in Chasoti have resulted in a devastating scene, with the recovery of numerous severed limbs alongside intact bodies. The confirmed death toll has reached 68, with 72 still missing, leaving little hope for survivors.

title: 'BJP wants Nitish, Naidu removed': Tejashwi slams Bill to remove PM, CMs
content: Tejashwi Yadav criticised the central government's new bill. The bill allows the removal of ministers facing serious criminal charges. Yadav alleged it targets Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu. He recalled past instances of chief ministers being jailed and later acquitted. He described the bill as a blackmail tactic. The bill mandates removal after 30 days of detention for serious offences.

title: VP election: INDIA bloc candidate B Sudershan Reddy files nomination
content: Justice (Retd) B Sudershan Reddy, the INDIA bloc's vice presidential candidate, submitted his nomination in Parliament, accompanied by prominent leaders like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sonia Gandhi, and Rahul Gandhi. Kharge emphasized that Reddy's nomination signifies the opposition's dedication to democratic values amidst concerns about stifled voices in Parliament.

title: Maha churn again? Raj meets CM Fadnavis; a day after drawing blank in 'BEST' polls
content: Raj Thackeray's meeting with Devendra Fadnavis sparks political buzz. This follows a defeat for Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS in the BEST credit society elections. The loss is seen as a setback before the upcoming BMC polls. Fadnavis commented on the rejection of the 'Thackeray brand'. Raj Thackeray had recently shared a stage with Uddhav, criticizing the BJP's language policy.

title: Online gaming bill: What does it mean for esports? 5 key points
content: Lok Sabha has passed the Online Gaming Bill, banning money-based games while promoting Esports and social gaming. The move addresses concerns about addiction and financial fraud, though some worry it will drive gaming underground. The bill recognises e-sports, categorises social games, and establishes a national authority to oversee online gaming, with strict penalties for violations.

title: 'Terrorists emerged out of several tunnels': Israel repels major Hamas assault - watch
content: Hamas gunmen launched a daring raid on an IDF encampment in southern Gaza, resulting in injuries to four Israeli soldiers. The attack involved at least 18 militants emerging from a tunnel, opening fire with machine guns and RPGs. Israeli forces responded with small arms and air support, eliminating approximately ten militants.

title: 'Blood all over': Shocking South Delhi triple murder; couple, son killed
content: In a gruesome incident in south Delhi's Satbari Khark village, Prem Singh, his wife Rajani, and their elder son Ritik were found murdered in their home. Police suspect the younger son, Siddharth, who is currently missing, is the prime suspect. Evidence suggests Siddharth, who was undergoing psychiatric treatment for obsessive-compulsive disorder and aggressive behavior, confessed to the crime before disappearing.

title: Delhi CM attacked: Rekha Gupta‚Äôs security under review; Z+ ASL cover likely
content: Following Wednesday's attack on CM Rekha Gupta, a security review is underway, potentially leading to Z+ ASL protection with an advanced security liaison team. An inquiry is investigating lapses, and stricter visitor verification protocols are expected. Gupta currently has 45 personnel, but additional measures like barricades may be implemented to enhance her safety.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink with UIDAI: Aadhar-based verification in India
content: Starlink, under Elon Musk, is partnering with UIDAI to streamline KYC for Indian users via Aadhaar-based verification. This collaboration enables quick, secure, and paperless onboarding, ensuring regulatory compliance and a user-friendly experience. The initiative highlights the scalability and reliability of India's digital infrastructure, demonstrating how Aadhaar supports innovative technology adoption while maintaining transparency and user control over personal data.

title: Nayara navigates EU sanctions: Dark-fleet tankers keep operations flowing
content: Facing EU sanctions, Nayara Energy is utilizing dark-fleet tankers and limiting crude import options to maintain operations, raising concerns for India's energy security. The government has authorized coastal tankers and approved sanctioned vessels to assist Nayara. The refiner, crucial to India's market, now relies on Russian oil and special mechanisms to circumvent sanctions, ensuring stable supply despite geopolitical challenges.

title: Report: Bullet fired into Reid's office in May '24
content: A bullet penetrated the glass in the practice facility office of Andy Reid while the Chiefs coach was working alone in it last year, The Kansas City Star reported Wednesday night.

title: Ohtani rocked, struck by liner in 'regrettable' start
content: Dodgers two-way star Shohei Ohtani gave up five earned runs and nine hits in four innings, and got hit on his thigh by a 93 mph line drive in an 8-3 loss to the Rockies.

title: Bueckers lights up L.A. for WNBA rookie-record 44
content: Dallas guard Paige Bueckers scored a WNBA rookie-record 44 points Wednesday night, but the Wings came up short in a buzzer-beating loss to the Sparks.

title: Sources: Jets land Phillips in 2nd DT trade of day
content: The Jets acquired Harrison Phillips from Minnesota, sources told ESPN, their second trade of the day for a defensive tackle after they added Jowon Briggs from the Browns.

title: 49ers WR Robinson faces 3-game suspension
content: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said Wednesday on San Francisco's KNBR radio that wide receiver Demarcus Robinson has been suspended three games stemming from a misdemeanor DUI charge.

title: Yankees tie MLB mark with 14 HRs over 2 games
content: New York finished with five home runs Wednesday night and 14 in the series sweep of the Rays, tying a major league record (Reds, 1999) for most homers in a two-game series.

title: Saints acquire WR Vele, send picks to Broncos
content: The Saints added to their receiver room ahead of the regular-season opener Wednesday, acquiring Devaughn Vele in a trade with the Broncos, who received two future draft picks in return.

title: Cowboys coach expects to have Parsons in opener
content: Cowboys coach Brian Schottenheimer is confident Pro Bowl edge rusher Micah Parsons will be available for the Sept. 4 season opener against the Eagles.

title: üëï A history of soccer's most iconic jerseys
content: How did soccer's most storied clubs become synonymous with something as simple as a color? ESPN relives the kit histories of football's biggest teams.

title: Ranking the best NFL teams to watch: Turn your TV to the Commanders, Ravens and ... Falcons?
content: Which NFL teams are must-watches every Sunday this season? We stacked all 32 by excitement, fun and intrigue, starting with Washington.

title: Projecting next year's QB market: Most likely scenarios and long shot possibilities
content: We picked teams with some level of QB1 uncertainty for 2026 and projected two potential outcomes for each.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Can anyone top this No. 1 team?
content: Baseball's top team is still rolling -- though might be slowing down -- while one NL contender continues its fall down our list in Week 21.

title: Vince Young's rise to college football legend began at Ohio State
content: Texas' 2005 title run started in Columbus, where Arch Manning and the Longhorns look to build a new legacy in '25.

title: Inside Brock Purdy's massive raise -- and the expectations for 2025 that follow
content: Purdy spent the offseason working on little things to improve his game after securing the biggest raise in NFL history.

title: Tour Championship rankings: From Scottie Scheffler all the way to No. 30
content: Who comes in at No. 2 behind Scheffler? Where do U.S. Ryder Cup hopefuls rank? We break down the entire Tour Championship field.

title: USMNT countdown to the World Cup: Does McKennie have Juve future?
content: Weston McKennie has barely featured for Juventus in preseason. Will he need to leave to ensure he's a starter for the U.S at next summer's World Cup?

title: 32 pick projections, eight months out: Yates‚Äô early NFL mock draft of Round 1 has some surprises
content: Could Arch Manning go No. 1? Will QBs dominate the first round? Which teams could land playmakers? Field Yates projects next year's opening 32 picks.

title: The best picks for each draft slot in Rounds 1 and 2 in 10-team leagues
content: Being prepared for anything gives you a leg up on draft day. We go through every slot to help you plan ahead and get off to a good start in your draft.

title: 10 European storylines to follow: Liverpool and City rebuild, Barca's defense, more
content: Even with predictable title races, each season has its own personality and plotlines. So here are 10 fun plots we're particularly interested in following across Europe as 2025-26 kicks into gear.

title: How Leagues Cup is becoming a hotbed for global scouting
content: With 36 Liga MX and MLS teams playing in Leagues Cup, interest in North American players is on the rise.

title: Predicting how Wirtz, Gy√∂keres and other big Premier League transfers will perform in 2025-26
content: Loads of big names have arrived in the Premier League this summer, so it's time for Luis Miguel Echegaray to break down who might succeed or flop.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Rogers, Eze after Havertz injury
content: Arsenal are closing on Crystal Palace star Eberechi Eze but are also tracking Aston Villa's Morgan Rogers.

title: New York finally solved Minnesota -- what does it mean for the WNBA playoffs?
content: Minnesota and New York met four times in 20 days. Here are five things we learned in their WNBA Finals rematches.

title: AFC North preview: Ravens favored, but Bengals lurk
content: Can the Bengals overcome the Ravens in the North? Here are all the odds for each team in the division and our favorite bets.

title: Red Sox icon Jason Varitek decides fantasy football draft order with batting practice
content: The Red Sox called on the 2005 Silver Slugger (and current Boston coach) to be the deciding factor of their fantasy draft order.

title: Jalen Brunson, Natalia Bryant star together in new Nike Kobe sneaker ad
content: A key feature of the new Nike Kobe 3 Protro is diamond shapes on the upper and outsole in honor of Natalia.

title: Americans Worry Democracy In Danger Amid Gerrymandering Fights: Survey
content: Most Americans believe that efforts to redraw US House of Representatives districts to maximise partisan gains, like those under way in Texas and California, are bad for democracy, a Reuters/Ipsos poll found.

title: Actor Vijay's Supporter Dies On Way To TVK's Mega Madurai Rally
content: A 33-year-old supporter of Tamil actor and politician Vijay died today while travelling to attend the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) mega state conference in Madurai.

title: Delhi Gets New Police Commissioner A Day After Attack On Chief Minister
content: A day after Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was attacked by a man during a public meeting at her residence, Delhi Police Commissioner SBK Singh has been replaced by 1992 batch officer Satish Golcha.

title: "Perplexed At Logic": S Jaishankar On US Tariff Over Purchase Of Russian Oil
content: External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar at a press briefing, said that India is "perplexed" at Washington's logic about New Delhi's purchase of Russian oil.

title: Pigeon With Threat Note To Bomb Jammu Railway Station Caught Near Border, Security Tightened
content: Security forces have captured a pigeon carrying a threat note to blow up the Jammu railway station in the border area of RS Pura in Jammu district, prompting police to beef up security in the region, officials said.

title: Video: Nitish Kumar Offered 'Topi' At Bihar Madrasa Event. This Happens
content: Nearly twelve years after he took a swipe at Narendra Modi, then his bitter rival, and said a leader has to embrace both 'topi' and 'tilak' to run the country, a video showing JDU president Nitish Kumar refusing to weara 'topi' is viral

title: "Maar Nahi Daalna Tha": Chilling Chat Of Gujarat Student Who Killed Senior
content: The death of a class 10 student after he was stabbed by a junior outside their school in Ahmedabad, has led to massive protests in the city.

title: Hurricane Erin Stirs Up Strong Winds, Floods Highway On Path Towards Sea
content: Hurricane Erin battered North Carolina's Outer Banks with strong winds and waves that flooded part of the main highway as the monster storm slowly began to move away from the East Coast.

title: Amid Trump's "Tariff Tantrum" Against India, Experts Warn Of China Problem
content: US President Donald Trump has faced the scrutiny of friends and foes alike since he all but declared an economic war against India

title: Slapped In Class, Student Returns With Gun In Lunch Box, Shoots Teacher
content: Gangandeep Singh Kohli teaches physics at a school in Uttarakhand's Udham Singh Nagar district. Earlier this week, he had slapped one of his students. On Wednesday, the same student packed a gun in his tiffin box and shot Mr Kohli in the back.

title: Raphael Graven, Frenchman Who Died During Livestream, Was Living "Best Life"
content: For some people close to him, Raphael Graven was living "his best life" in the years before he died during a live-streamed event on Monday, watched by thousands.

title: "Diverted Rs 10 Crore Because...": BJP Livid Over Karnataka Funds For Wayanad
content: The move of Karnataka's Siddaramaiah government to give a Rs 10-crore grant to families affected by landslides in Kerala's Wayanad has set up a fresh face-off with the state's Opposition BJP.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 'Alien', 'Pajeet', 'Browns Off Cliffs': How Indians Became The Most Hated Diaspora
content: Indians abroad are facing a storm - a surge in racial hostility that is fuelled by envy, stereotypes and far-right paranoia. They are admired and resented, successful and scapegoated, celebrated in official speeches but vilified in everyday life.

title: Gaganyaan's 1st Uncrewed Mission To Launch With Half-Humanoid In December
content: The first uncrewed mission of the Gaganyaan human spaceflight mission, G1, is ready to launch with the half-humanoid robot -- Vyommitra -- and the launch is expected in December, said V. Narayanan, Chairman of the ISRO

title: Iran Navy Launches First Military Drill After 12-Day War With Israel
content: Iran launched its first military exercise since the end of its 12-day war with Israel, state television reported Thursday, with navy vessels launching missiles at targets at sea in the Gulf of Oman and the Indian Ocean.

title: Thailand's Shinawatra Dynasty Faces Court Verdicts That Could Shake Politics
content: Thailand's billionaire Shinawatra family is bracing for a series of high-stakes court decisions starting Friday that could test its political resilience, with the prospect of an early election and prolonged trouble for country's stuttering economy.

title: Russia To Boost Nuclear Shield Amid 'Colossal Threat': State Nuclear Chief
content: Russia's nuclear shield should be strengthened in coming years due to the "colossal threats" facing the world's biggest nuclear power, the head of Russia's state nuclear corporation said on Thursday.

title: Key Panel Accepts Centre's Proposal To Move To 2 GST Slabs, Down From 4
content: A key meeting of the Group of Ministers (GoM) on GST rate rationalisation on Thursday ended with state finance minister accepting the Centre's plan to reduce the number of tax slabs.

title: Japanese Man, 93, Was Presumed To Be Killed By Bear. Attacker Was His Son
content: Fujiyuki Shindo, 51, was arrested on Tuesday in Daisen for allegedly stabbing his 93-year-old father, Fujiyoshi, to death at their home on Monday afternoon.

title: An Arvind Kejriwal Move Prompted Government To Get 'Sack Ministers' Bill
content: The Centre decided to bring a law to remove Chief Ministers and ministers jailed for more than a month after being charged with serious offences after former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal did not resign after he was arrested

title: Earthquake in J&K: 3.5 magnitude quake hits Kupwara; follows twin tremors in Himachal‚Äôs Chamba
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Bharat aaj bhi ... ': Shubhanshu Shukla recounts space journey; talks about Axiom-4 mission
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Karnataka Crowd Control Bill referred to House panel after Opposition seeks clarity on commercial, non-commercial events
content: The Opposition argued that the Bill could end up becoming ‚Äòa weapon‚Äô for the police, especially against political parties

title: Former DG of Border Roads Organisation appointed as Telangana govt advisor on Irrigation
content: Lt. Gen. Harpal Singh  was crucial in completion of Atal and other key tunnels. He earlier offered his expertise in rescue operation at Telangana‚Äôs SLBC tunnel.

title: Rahul joins second leg of 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar
content: Rahul Gandhi, who returned to the State after a day-long break, joined the Yatra in Lakhisarai district, hours after the second leg was kicked off by his ally Tejashwi Yadav of the RJD in adjoining Sheikhpura

title: High-end surveillance cameras to be operational soon on Kozhikode bypass
content: The Vengalam-Ramanattukara stretch will have 47 cameras which will be linked to a control room at Mampuzha for real-time monitoring

title: Telangana forecast to get break from rain this weekend
content: Hyderabad and its surrounding areas are very likely to receive light rain or thundershowers accompanied with gusty winds (30-40 kmph) towards evening or night.

title: Senior IPS officer Satish Golcha appointed Delhi Police Commissioner
content: Previously, S.B.K. Singh, was given additional charge as the Delhi Police Commissioner on August 1, 2025

title: Cancer should be declared notifiable disease across States, Union Territories: Parliamentary¬†panel
content: The Committee recommended imposing a high-risk cess or heavy taxes on tobacco products and said that the revenue earned may be utilised for supplementing cancer research and cancer care across the country

title: HUDCO international convention centre to come up in Amaravati, says Pemmasani
content: The project, to be developed on 10 acres under HUDCO, has already secured preliminary approval for eight acres from the Andhra Pradesh CRDA

title: Madras High Court dismisses IIT-Madras professor‚Äôs plea against findings of sexual harassment inquiry
